Recap: Cristian and Natalie arrive at Antonio's office and Cristian tells that they know who set him up and that Natalie is there to confirm what happened. The door flies open and Vincent enters shouting that he will confess. He will do whatever his has to do in cooperation with the police on this. Chris is surprised and asks why Vincent is doing this. "Why do you think?" He peers at Natalie beside him. Kelly is awake and she gets to go and see her baby. "He is so small " Claudia finds Nash having his morning coffee and tells him that the big announcement of Antonio and Jessica's wedding has hit the paper. She suggests they take off until that whole thing blows over. Nash won't go. She tells him that he is crazier than Jessica and Tess put together. She wonders if he has thought that Jessica might not want him at her wedding. "Why don't you ask me that?" The DNA results are in and Asa refuses to go to the hospital to get the results. He can 't. He orders that Spencer be brought to him at the house to hear the results. Bo arrives at the jail and tells Spencer that he is getting out of there. Spencer gets up smiling. Vincent is furious when he learns he is going to be charged with Attempted Murder, but confesses just the same. He hasn't been arrested before and is told the procedure as well as the fact that Evangeline will be alerted since she is the ADA. Chris calls off the investigation and Rex gives Layla the news that Vincent has confessed. She runs to the station in time to see Vincent cuffed and led out to a cell. She worries when she realizes that her sister will be prosecuting the case and that the charge is Attempted Murder. David comes to see Spencer. Spencer finds that for someone who hates him, David sure spends a lot of time there. David has been thinking and he realizes that Spencer has been hating Asa all these years and he took his anger out on everyone else. "I get it. I was really a part of the family while you were just an illegitimate twig! Unwanted!" Bo arrives and tells Spencer that the results of the DNA tests will be revealed at his house and that Spencer is to be transported over there. Kevin and Kelly hear the alarm go off on the baby's monitor. Zane is in trouble but Dr. Goldman manages to stabilize him. "He is disconnected. You need to prepare yourself." Kevin orders that the child be given to him. He takes the infant and talks to him of his strong mother and father who would have loved him. "I will be here for you." Beep! Beep! A nurse tells that means that baby's heart is beating stronger and that is the first time that has happened since the child has come into the world!
Transcript: Layla: Morning. Ahem.
Adriana: Hey. Still losing sleep over Vincent?
Layla: I know -- stupid, huh?
Adriana: You were really into him.
Layla: And why?
Adriana: Hmm.
Layla: How could I go r a guy like that? My sister tried to warn me. I never thought I'd do that again.
Adriana: "Again"?
Rex: Adriana, I wasn't -- oh, Layla! Hey.
Layla: Ok.
Rex: I didn't know you were here.
Layla: Just get over yourself. I can handle your old boxer shorts.

Viki: Good.

Clint: Yeah. Well, we've been keeping an eye on Zane.
Kevin: Sure.
Kelly: , God. There he is.

Claudia: Well, I like mine light and sweet -- you remembered.
Nash: Not for you.

Nash: You know, can we call a little ceasefire in this Jessica thing, at least just for this morning, all right?
Claudia: Ok.
Nash: All right.
Claudia: Ok, truce. So who were you having coffee with?
Nash: No one. They are both for me.
Claudia: That bad a night last night?
Nash: No, it was a great night. Just up late working on the vineyard.
Claudia: Oh, I thought maybe you saw the announcement in the paper.
Nash: What announcement?
Claudia: Jessica and Antonio's wedding? Huge picture -- I guess when mommy owns the paper -- hmm.
Nash: Hmm.

Nash: How am I feeling about the wedding? Ask me after, all right?
Claudia: I've got a better idea.

Claudia: Let's get out of town, today. Yeah. It's -- it would be great. Put as many miles between you and the Buchanans as possible.

Bo: Hey. Morning, Pa.
Asa: Oh, I know that face. That's the face of a Buchanan with bad news. Give it to me straight, Bo.
Bo: Spencer Truman's DNA test results are in.
Spencer: Oh, good. You're back. What now?
David: Ding. DNA's ready.
Spencer: Yeah, I know, David. I know. I'm -- I'm really sorry, man. Looks like we're only half brothers after all, doesn't it?
David: Well, that's a half too many. I wish we weren't related at all, you son of a bitch.
Asa: Don't just stand there, Bo. Is that bastard my son or not?
Bo: Now, look, I want you to calm down, ok? This isn't good for your heart.
Asa: My heart will be a lot easier. Now, out with it.
Bo: All right -- I don't know what the results are. I just know that they're in. That's all. And I requested that both parties be present when the envelopes are opened.
Asa: Well, let's light a fire under Nigel and get me down to Truman's cell.
Bo: No. I don't think that's such a good idea now.
Asa: I don't -- I don't care what you think, Bo. I'm going myself. Nigel?
Bo: Now --
Asa: Oh.
Bo: Hey -- no. Are you ok?
Asa: Hey, wait, I'm fine.
Bo: Here. Drink this. Ok? Just drink it. I wouldn't -- I -- you've got to stay calm or you're going to end up back in the hospital again.
Asa: And I'm not going back to that hospital, Bo. If I can't go to the mountain, then you got to find a way to bring the mountain to me.
Bo: What are you talking about?
Asa: Bring Truman here -- now.
[SCENE_BREAK]
David: You know, I didn't sleep at all last night knowing that the test results would be in, and it did something to me, staying up, thinking about it.
Spencer: Yeah, I know what you were thinking about, David. You were staying up obsessing about all that money that you're imagining that I'm going to get, and I don't even have it yet.

David: I would be glad if you were Asa Buchanan's son for one reason -- because if that were true, the only thing that you and I would share is our mother. The more distance I can put between you and me, the happier I will be.
Spencer: You know, I've known since I was a teenager that we were only half brothers, but it never made me love you any less, Dave.
David: If I were tied to railroad tracks and a speeding locomotive were coming at me, you would wave goodbye, and then watch from behind a video camera.
Spencer: Oh, all right -- how can you say that, man, after all the times I've bailed you out? Come on.

David: You let me take the fall for everything you ever did. You killed Thomas Mc Bain -- it wasn't Paige, it certainly wasn't me, and you let me live with that guilt for 25 years. Well, you know what? Now it's my turn to watch you suffer and I am going to watch you suffer. Even if it's only half as much as what I went through, I'm going to enjoy every single minute of it.
Spencer: That's because you're a sick bastard, Dave.
David: As it turns out, Spencer, you're the bastard.
Spencer: Well, enjoy it while you can. So what -- the tables have turned on me for once, temporarily. Things will go my way again. They always do.
David: You make hating you so easy.

Spencer: You say you hate me, but you just can't quite seem to stay away, can you, David? You think I don't know what this is all about for one second? You think I don't believe that this is all about money for you?
David: I want something more than money from you. I want you out of my life once and for all.

Vincent: Why do you think?

Nash: I am not wallowing.

Kevin: What?

Kevin: What's --

Nash: Yeah.

David: It all makes sense now, doesn't it? The reason you hated the Buchanans, Asa ruined our mother's life. And you were never accepted by the family that incidentally never even knew you existed. But you had to get even with them, didn't you? So you waited and you plotted and you took your anger out on everybody else around you -- me, Paige, Thomas Mc Bain.
Spencer: You know, it looks like this is going to take a while, so since I can't reach through the bar and just, you know, shut off your air supply, I'm going to sit down for a minute. You mind?
David: Did you hate me just because I was dad's real son?
Spencer: David, I hated that bastard, all right? You have no idea how happy I was to find out that I was not part of his particular gene pool, all right?
David: Ok, so then you were better than us?
Spencer: Hmm.
David: We were trash and you were a Buchanan.
Spencer: Buchanans were no better.
David: And you were the illegitimate product of both families, which left you with no real family at all. I'm on to something here, aren't I?
Spencer: You know, David, this whole pseudo-psychoanalycal detective thing you do, it's really getting annoying. You ought to get a hobby.

David: U were as jealous of me as you were of Bo and Clint, because I had something. I had something that you could never have -- a spot on the family tree while you were just the illegitimate twig, ignored, unwanted.
Spencer: What now?
Bo: You're getting out of here.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Viki: The doctors aren't making any promises about the baby, Zane, but we're hoping.
Asa: There's nothing to worry about. The kid's a Buchanan. He's going to come out just fine.

Asa: I tell you, he's going to haul that cretin over here, and when they read the results, Truman's not going to be able to complain that anything suspicious happened.
Viki: Are you really up to that, Asa?
Asa: I feel fine. And I'm going to feel a lot better when I know we're done with Spencer Truman.

Asa: There is not a chance in hell.
Clint: Pa, you slept with his mother. Spencer Truman could be a Buchanan, and there's not one damn thing we can do about it.
Spencer: It's about time you came to your senses and let me out of here.
David: What about the boatload of evidence you had against him?
Bo: No, don't worry, don't worry. He's still charged with murder. It's just that I'm taking him over to my father's house.

Bo: We're going to read the results of the DNA test. There'll be an independent observer there who's been approved by lawyers from both sides. There'll be two sets of identical results -- one for you, one for Asa.

David: You think I can go, too?
Bo: I don't have a problem with that.

Bo: Malloy? We're going to get this thing over with once and for all.
Spencer: Anything you say, bro.

Cristian: And how is that supposed to happen? You know, maybe losing this fight didn't kill me, but it killed any prospects I had. What am I supposed to do now?

Vincent: You know, I've done some things in my life that I can't take back and I'm really sorry about that, but most of all, I'm sorry for disappointing you.

Kevin: You know, I'm just -- I think maybe it's because of me that he's -- he's not connecting, you know? He's -- thank you. I mean, because I haven't, you know, and -- I mean, he feels your love, Kelly. I know he does. He knows his mom's here, but his dad's not. So, you know, if I can be here for Duke, maybe -- maybe it'll make the difference. Maybe that'll be enough to give him what he needs to -- to want to live.
Kelly: It's worth a try.
Kevin: All right.
Kevin: Thanks.
Kevin: All right, thank you.
Kevin: Oh. He's so -- so small.
Kelly: Yeah.

Kevin: Hello there, Zane. Hey. I know you don't know me, but you're a part of me. And I -- I need you to do something for me, ok? I need you to find the part of you that's your mother. Because that part has so much love in it, and -- and that's the kind of love that can get you through anything. And there's -- there's another part of you, too -- it's your dad. And I know that he's not here right now, but he would've loved you so much. And I'm sorry that he's not here, I -- I am, but I -- but I'm here for him, ok? And I love you. I would do anything for you. Anything.
[Monitor chimes]
Kelly: What's going on? What's happening?
Dr. Goldman: His heartbeat's getting stronger -- first time since he's been in here.
